newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Ziff-Davis regains titles from Packer unit.
newsitem.headline: Ziff-Davis regains titles from Packer unit.

text.p: U.S.-based computer magazine publisher, Ziff-Davis Inc, said on Thursday the licenses to publish "PC Magazine" Australia, "PC Magazine" New Zealand, and "PC Week" Australia will revert to the company from Australian Consolidated Press Ltd (ACP).
ACP, the magazine division of Kerry Packer's Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd, will cease publishing "PC Magazine" and "PC Week" after the current issues, it said.
Subscribers to the magazines will receive U.S. editions until local versions are published, it said.
Ziff-Davis said it plans to resume Australian and New Zealand local editions by the end of the year.

"Ziff-Davis is taking this opportunity to ensure our best global brands deliver as promised in Australia and New Zealand," J.B. Holston, president of Ziff-Davis International Media Group, said in a statement.

Ziff-Davis said it continues to publish locally through its licensee, Australian Provincial Newspaper's Holdings Ltd's APN Computing Group Pty Ltd, Windows Sources, Family PC, and the online services ZDNet and Gamespot.
The company said it also publishes the Australian MacUser through its licensee, Niche Media Pty Ltd.
Ziff-Davis is a subsidiary of Japanese software group Softbank Corp.
